decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (2518- 01/FP; 2518- 02/FP; 2518- 03/FP; 2518- 04/FP; 2518- 05/FP; Design and Access Statement; Delivery Statement. Received 13/12/2018. 2518- 06/FP. Received 19/12/2018) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - The ventilation flue hereby permitted shall be subject to regular servicing and maintenance as well as best practice shall be implemented by the proprietors. Records of such works shall be documented.

Condition : 4 - The use shall not commence until not less than three 240 litre bins have been made available on site within the area for refuse storage shown on the approved plans, together with facilities for the separation and safe storage of glass, metal, plastics, cardboard, food waste and other recyclable materials which shall then be collected and taken to a suitable facility for recycling.  The storage area and bins shall be kept permanently and no waste shall be stored outside the site or other than in the identified storage area.  Non-recyclable and perishable waste shall be removed from site no less frequently than once a week.  Waste shall be removed as soon as the bins become full if this is earlier than the time of the normal collections, unless additional covered and enclosed bins have been provided and stored inside the building and are thereafter made permanently available for the on-site storage of refuse and waste.

Condition : 5 - The opening hours of the premises shall be 10:00 am to 12:00 pm between Monday and Saturday and 10:00 am to 11:00 pm on Sundays and Bank Holidays and no staff business or customer activity shall take place after 12 pm on any day or before 10 am the following day other than that necessary for the premises to be vacated and secured.

Condition : 6 - The level of noise emitted from any commercial plant installed at the premises shall not be less than 10dB(A) below the existing background noise levels (LAeq), when measured from the nearest noise sensitive receptor, over any 24 hour period in accordance with the guidance set by BS 4142:2014.
description: Change of use from Retail (A1) to Restaurant (Use Class A3) with ancillary takeaway (A5) and extractor flue
